Yes 1.1.1. Partially. The development of law was based on the Decree of the President of Uzbekistan from August 1, 2018 “On measures to drastically improve the investment climate in the Republic of Uzbekistan” (attached), The Law aimed at resolving concerns, providing additional opportunities warranted by law, increasing investment and improving country’s business environment was prepared and its public discussions is been facilitated. 1.1.2. The project experts prepared an Information and Analytical Report on topical issues of the development of the FEZ in the Republic of Uzbekistan, which was used in the development of Presidential Decree of the Republic of Uzbekistan UP-5600 dated December 21, 2018 On measures to further improve the system of coordination and management of free economic zones . RRF Indicator 1.1. Strategy of the investment policy of the Republic of Uzbekistan till 2025 is adopted. The goal of the investment policy strategy until 2025 is to create conditions for the successful implementation of the countrys socio-economic development priorities, identifying sources and mechanisms for attracting funding for the implementation of measures and measures to ensure sustainable economic growth, increase the competitiveness of the national economy, strengthen industrial potential and develop territories. The strategy defines Forecast indicators of investments in fixed capital by sources of financing, by types of economic activity and by regions of the republic till 2025.
RRF Indicator 1.2.: The Senate of Oliy Majlis, Ministry of Investments and foreign trade and Ministry of economy and industry are supported to evaluate policy options on investment climate improvement with an assessment of their impact on various segments of the economy and society Support parliamentary hearings on investment climate improvement, ease of doing business, specific issues of the development of the special zones in Uzbekistan. 2019 Actual result: 1.1. Yes 1.1.1. The project experts, based on the previously developed Investment Code, developed a draft Concept, text and analytical materials of the Law “On Investments and Investment Activities” (attached), which consists of 10 sections, 42 chapters and 250 articles. The development of law was based on the Decree of the President of Uzbekistan from August 1, 2018 “On measures to drastically improve the investment climate in the Republic of Uzbekistan” (attached), The Law aimed at resolving concerns, providing additional opportunities warranted by law, increasing investment and improving country’s business environment was prepared and its public discussions is been facilitated. 1.1.2. The Law “On Public-Private Partnership” developed with the support of Project was signed by the President on May 10, 2019. The Project team and experts took an active part in the development of its concept and discussions of the draft text of the law. This law will give a start to PPP based projects, which is to serve as a successful step in the development of a new principle of interaction between government, society and the business community in infrastructure projects - roads, airports, hospitals, schools, waste collection and processing, renewable energy and etc. It also opens up new opportunities in project financing and will put Uzbekistan on investors radars, both local and foreign. Now, business will be allowed to be presented in much more areas of economy and it should dramatically increase the number of potential investment projects in the country The adoption of this law will have a direct effect on the achievement of a number of actions and sustainable development goals, implemented in Uzbekistan, including: SDG 8. Good Jobs and Economic Growth Action 8.10 Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all SDG 9. Innovation and Infrastructure Action 9.2 Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industry’s share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries. Action 9.4 By 2030, upgrade infrastructure and retrofit industries to make them sustainable, with increased resource-use efficiency and greater adoption of clean and environmentally sound technologies and industrial processes, with all countries taking action in accordance with their respective capabilities and etc. You can find the full text of the law following the below given links: http://www.lex.uz/ru/pdfs/4329272 - Russian 1.1.3. The Law “On Special Economic Zones” adopted. The draft of the Law and its concept was prepared by expertise support of the Project. The law regulates relations arising from the creation, operation, extension and termination of special economic zones. The Law consist of 6 chapters and 40 articles.
